    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(float[][] ea)
        Initializes the matrix with a 2d floating point array. This matches exactly the constructor Matrix(float[][] ea). This is to provide methods inside this class to initialize the entire matrix
        Parameters:
        ea - a 2 dimensional floating point array

      • init

        public void init(float[][] ea,
                 int m,
                 int n)
        Initializes the matrix with a 2d floating point array and specified dimensions This differs from __init__(float[][] ea) as the 2d floating point array can be of zero length initially
        Parameters:
        ea - the 2d floating point array
        m - number of rows of the matrix
        n - number of columns of the matrix

      • slash

        public Matrix slash(float location,
                    float length)
             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Slashes the matrix using relative location and length.

        Cuts out a portion of the matrix with specified location and length.
        Does not affect the current matrix
        Parameters:
        location - location of the output matrix ranging from 0 to 1
        length - length of the output matrix ranging from 0 to 1 (the original matrix has a length of 1)
        Returns:
        the slashed matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when either variable is outside the range of [0, 1]

      • slash

        public Matrix slash(int start,
                    int length)
             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Slashes the matrix using absolute location and length.

        Cuts out a portion of the matrix with specified start row and length
        Does not affect the current matrix
        Parameters:
        start - start row of the output matrix
        length - length of the output matrix
        Returns:
        the slashed matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever the location of the output matrix lie outside the original matrix

      • slash

        public float[][] slash(float[][] ea,
                       float location,
                       float length)
                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Slashes a 2d floating point array using relative location and length.

        Cuts out a portion of the array with specified location and length.
        Parameters:
        ea - the 2d floating point array
        location - location of the output matrix ranging from 0 to 1
        length - length of the output matrix ranging from 0 to 1 (the original matrix has a length of 1)
        Returns:
        the slashed array
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when either location or length is outside the range of [0, 1]
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when the slashed array have a length of 0

      • fs

        public static Matrix fs(InfoPacket data,
                        Matrix M)
        Performs an operation on 1 matrix passed in.

        All other information passed in must go through the data variable.
        This variable will usually contain 2 integers: the first one for the type of operation and if the operation is 0 (activation function) or 1 (derivative of activation function) then the second integer specifies the activation family.
        Parameters:
        data - the data
        M - the matrix to be operated
        Returns:
        the resulting matrix
        See Also:
        List of possible operations

      • fs

        public static Matrix fs(int index,
                        Matrix M)
        Performs an operation on 1 matrix passed in. This functions is like fs(InfoPacket, Matrix) but is easier to use.
        Parameters:
        index - the type of operation to perform on the matrix
        M - the matrix to be operated
        Returns:
        the resulting matrix

      • matxF

        public static float matxF(InfoPacket data,
                          float x)
        Performs an operation on 1 floating point value passed in.

        All other information passed in must go through the data variable.
        This variable will specify what operations to do to the floating point value. It will always contain an integer describing the operations:
        0 - use an activation function
        1 - use the derivative of an activation function
        2 - negates the value
        3 (deprecated) - generate random values for the matrix
        4 - returns the sign of the value
        Other - returns the value itself

        For operations 0 and 1, there will be a family of activation family associated and this will be specified in the second integer inside the "data" variable. See famDesc for a list of possible activation families
        Parameters:
        data - the data packet
        x - the value to be operated
        Returns:
        the transformed value

      • matxF

        public static float matxF(int index,
                          float x)
        Performs an operation on 1 floating point value passed in.

        This function is like matxF(InfoPacket, float) but is easier to use.
        Parameters:
        index - the type of operation to perform on the matrix
        x - the value to be operated
        Returns:
        the transformed value

      • matxF

        public static float matxF(int index,
                          float x,
                          float y)
        Performs an operation on 2 floating point value passed in.
        Parameters:
        index - the type of operation to perform
        x - the first value
        y - the second value
        Returns:
        the transformed value

      • familyBounds

        public static float[] familyBounds(int family)
        Returns the boundaries of a particular activation function family.

        For example, sigmoid range/boundary is (0, 1) while hyperbolic tangent range/boundary is (-1, 1).
        Parameters:
        family - the family number
        Returns:
        the range/boundaries of the specified activation function family

      • acti

        public static Matrix acti(Matrix M)

        Returns:
        the transformed matrix

        family - the activation function family. See possible options at famDesc.
        Returns:
        the transformed value

        Use the activation function derivative on a single matrix. The family will be the default family. See family variable for the default value.

        Returns:
        the transformed matrix

        public static Matrix sign(Matrix matrix)

        Returns:
        the transformed matrix

      • gaussianMatrix

        public static Matrix gaussianMatrix(int row,
                                    int column,
                                    float expectedValue,
                                    float deviation)
        Generates a matrix randomized according to the Gaussian curve.
        Parameters:
        row - the number of rows the resulting matrix has
        column - the number of columns the resulting matrix has
        expectedValue - the mean (mu) of the Gaussian curve
        deviation - the deviation (sigma) of the Gaussian curve
        Returns:
        the resulting randomized matrix

      • gaussianMatrix

        public static Matrix gaussianMatrix(int row,
                                    int column,
                                    float deviation)

        Parameters:

        column - the number of columns the resulting matrix has
        deviation - the deviation (sigma) of the Gaussian curve
        Returns:
        the resulting randomized matrix

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the index with the highest value

      • getConfidence

        public static float getConfidence(float[] Y,
                                  float lowerBound,
                                  float upperBound)
        Gets the confidence of a 1d floating point array.

        For each element a inside the array, a value b=min(abs(a-lowerBound), abs(a-upperBound)) is calculated.
        The confidence is the sum of all values of b
        Parameters:
        Y - the input floating point array
        lowerBound - the lower boundary of the activation function
        upperBound - the upperBound of the activation function
        Returns:
        the confidence of the array

      • getConfidence

        public static float getConfidence(float[] Y,
                                  int family)
        Gets the confidence of a 1d floating point array with a specified activation function family.
        Parameters:
        Y - the input floating point array
        family - the activation function family we are considering.
        Returns:
        the confidence of the array

      • getConfidence

        public static float getConfidence(float[] Y)
        Gets the confidence of a 1d floating point array of the sigmoid activation function.
        Parameters:
        Y - the input floating point array
        Returns:
        the confidence of the array

      • calcAccuracy

        public static float calcAccuracy(Matrix Y,
                                 Matrix P,
                                 boolean highestIndex)
        Gets the similarity of the two matrix.

        For each row of the 2 matrix, a value b is recorded which equals 1 if the highest index of both rows are the same and 0 if otherwise.
        The similarity of the two matrix is calculated by averaging all values of b.
        Parameters:
        Y - the first matrix
        P - the second matrix
        highestIndex - the mode of the method, whether to get the highest or the lowest element
        Returns:
        the similarity of the two matrix
        See Also:
        getHighestIndex(float[]), getLowestIndex(float[])

      • calcAccuracy

        public static float calcAccuracy(Matrix Y,
                                 Matrix P)
        Gets the similarity of the two matrix.

        For each row of the 2 matrix, a value b is recorded which equals 1 if the highest index of both rows are the same and 0 if otherwise.
        The similarity of the two matrix is calculated by averaging all values of b.
        The default highestValue mode is set to true in the original calcAccuracy(Matrix, Matrix, boolean) method
        Parameters:
        Y - the first matrix
        P - the second matrix
        Returns:
        the similarity of the two matrix

      • calcConfidence

        public static float calcConfidence(Matrix Y,
                                   int family)
        Splits the matrix into individual rows and averages the confidence on all possible rows.
        Parameters:
        Y - the input matrix
        family - the activation family under consideration
        Returns:
        the average confidence of the matrix

      • calcConfidence

        public static float calcConfidence(Matrix Y)
        Splits the matrix into individual rows and averages the confidence on all possible rows.

        This method assumes the activation value is sigmoid.
        Parameters:
        Y - the input matrix
        Returns:
        the average confidence of the matrix
